snippet: The generic drug maker Ranbaxy pleaded guilty to federal drug safety violations at two of its plants in India and will pay a $500 million fine.
abstract: Generic drug maker Ranbaxy pleads guilty to federal drug safety violations and will pay $500 million in fines to resolve claims that it sold subpar drugs and made false statements to the Food and Drug Administration about its manufacturing practices at two factories in India; settlement is largest in history involving generic manufacturer and drug safety.
lead_paragraph: The generic drug maker Ranbaxy pleaded guilty to federal drug safety violations at two of its plants in India and will pay a $500 million fine.

headline.seo: Ranbaxy in $500 Million Settlement of Generic Drug Case
headline.main: Generic Drug Maker Pleads Guilty in Federal Case
headline.print_headline: Generic Drug Maker Pleads Guilty in Federal Case
